c:complexType.name: ContinuousCartesianAxisOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The options documentation class of the cartesian axis panel for continuous scale types (numeric or timeSeries).
For more information about cartesian axes please see the comments in the base class .

c:property.name: fixedMin
c:property.c:documentation:
The fixed minimum domain value that the axis will show.
The value should be convertible to the scale type of the axis. A string value is converted to a number. If a numeric value is obtained and the scale type is time series, then the number is interpreted as being the result of the JavaScript's Date.getTime() method.
The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual minimum value of the data.
When this property is specified, clipping is activated in the plot panel. Elements that are drawn beyond its area are clipped.
This property takes precedence over the property originIsZero.

c:property.name: fixedMax
c:property.c:documentation:
The fixed maximum domain value that the axis will show.
The value should be convertible to the scale type of the axis. A string value is converted to a number. If a numeric value is obtained and the scale type is time series, then the number is interpreted as being the result of the JavaScript's Date.getTime() method.
The value may be bigger or smaller than the actual maximum value of the data.
When this property is specified, clipping is activated in the plot panel. Elements that are drawn beyond its area are clipped.
This property takes precedence over the property originIsZero.

c:property.name: originIsZero
c:property.c:documentation:
Indicates if it should be ensured that zero domain value is shown.
The properties fixedMin and fixedMax have precedence over this one. If this property is true and respecting it would require changing the minimum value, but the option fixedMin is also specified, then this property is ignored. The same would apply if it were required to change the maximum value, but the property fixedMax was also specified.

c:property.name: domainScope
c:property.c:documentation:
Controls the type of scale domain coordination that should be performed amongst the axes of the same id of each small chart.
The value can only be specified if the axis has vertical orientation. Conversely, the value can only be specified if the axis has horizontal orientation.

c:property.name: ticks
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if major ticks are shown for each tick value.

c:property.name: minorTicks
c:property.c:documentation: Indicates if minor ticks are shown between major ticks.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the panel.

c:complexType.name: ContinuousCartesianAxisExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation:
The extension points of the continuous cartesian axis panel.
To use an extension point you must find its full name, by joining:
panel property name (ex: xAxis)
extension property (ex: minorTicks)
the "_" character
extension sub-property (ex: strokeStyle)
and obtaining, for the examples, the camel-cased name: xAxisMinorTicks_strokeStyle (see ).

c:property.name: minorTicks
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of a minor tick rule mark.
